contentrichtext.text: '''Yvon Krevé''', also known as '''Von Von''', is a [[French Canadian]] [[hip hop music|hip hop]] artist of [[Haitian people|Haitian]] {{where|date=January 2012}} origin.<ref name="Pegram2005">{{cite book|author=Scooter Pegram|title=Choosing their own style: identity emergence among Haitian youth in Québec|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=QiLVRbY1S1UC&pg=PA119|accessdate=25 May 2011|date=30 September 2005|publisher=Peter Lang|isbn=978-0-8204-7868-5|pages=119–}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.cyberpresse.ca/arts/musique/critiques-cd/201010/15/01-4332885-la-force-du-nombre-le-hip-hop-modele-quebecois-12.php |title=La force du nombre: le hip-hop, modèle québécois |author=Marie-Christine Blais|work=La Presse|date=16 October 2010 |accessdate=25 May 2011}}</ref> Krevé was rose to notice following collaborations with the duo [[Sans Pression]].<ref name=lp/> His 2000 debut, ''L'accent grave'', topped the Quebec sales charts and was nominated for an [[ADISQ]] hip-hop award in 2001, and won best francophone album at the [[Canadian Music Awards]].<ref name=mp>{{cite web |url= http://www.musiqueplus.com/yvon-kreve |title=Biographie de Yvon Krevé |work=musiqueplus.com |year=2011 [last update] |accessdate=25 May 2011}}</ref> and in 2009 was described in the newspaper [[La Presse (Canadian newspaper)|La Presse]] as one of the 5 albums that had defined Quebec rap.<ref name=lp>{{cite news|url= http://www.cyberpresse.ca/arts/musique/disques/200908/06/01-890167-cinq-albums-qui-ont-defini-le-rap-quebecois.php |title=Cinq albums qui ont défini le rap québécois |author=Philippe Renaud|newspaper=August 6, 2009 |accessdate=25 May 2011}}</ref> A single from that album, "Yvon Krevé", reached number one on the countdown programme for Canada's leading [[francophone]] music video channel (''Décompte [[MusiquePlus]]'').<ref name=mp/> The name is a [[play on words]]: while Yvon is a not-uncommon first name, it matches the informal [[Quebec French]] pronunciation of ''ils vont'' (they will). Thus the full name sounds like ''ils vont crever'', or "they're gonna die". ==Discography== *6 June 2000: ''L'accent grave'' *18 March 2003: ''Quand j'rap pas'' *25 October 2005: ''Von Von Le vet'' ==See also== * {{fr icon}} [[:fr:Rap québécois|Rap québécois]], on French Wikipedia ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *{{fr icon}} [http://www.orangemusic.net/Yvon_Kreve.html Orange Music (label) site: Yvon Krevé] *{{fr icon}} [http://hhqc.com/artistes/artistes.php?id=812 HHQC: Yvon Krevé] {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2010}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Kreve, Yvon | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = Krevé, Yvon (French) | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Canadian musician | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = Haiti | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Kreve, Yvon}} [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Place of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:Haitian emigrants to Canada]] [[Category:Black Canadian musicians]] [[Category:Canadian rappers]] [[Category:Hip hop singers]] [[Category:French-language singers of Canada]] {{Canada-singer-stub}} {{hiphop-bio-stub}}
